episode_summary: This episode features discussions on the founder of Aldi negotiating his own ransom, the world's largest model train collection, the myth of William Tell, and the famous 'Who shot JR?' storyline from the TV show Dallas.

facts.fact: When the founder of the budget supermarket chain Aldi was kidnapped in the 1970s, he successfully negotiated a discount off his own ransom.
The world's largest collection of model trains doesn't fit on standard model train tracks.
In 1760, a book was publicly burned in Switzerland because it claimed that William Tell did not exist.
To make sure that no one leaked the answer to who shot JR on the TV show Dallas, the production team had every main character film a scene of them shooting JR, including JR.
